name: qgis

variants.name: custom_widgets
variants.description: Build QGIS custom widgets for Qt Designer

variants.name: grass7
variants.description: Build with GRASS providers and plugin

variants.name: gui
variants.description: Build QGIS GUI library and everything built on top of it

variants.name: internal_o2
variants.description: Download and locally include source of o2 library

variants.name: py_compile
variants.description: Byte compile Python modules in staged or installed locations

variants.name: staged_plugins
variants.description: Stage-install core Python plugins to run from build directory

description:
QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic
information system application that supports viewing, editing, and
analysis of geospatial data.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: exiv2
dependencies.description:
Exiv2 is a Cross-platform C++ library and a command line utility to
manage image metadata

dependencies.name: expat
dependencies.description: Expat is an XML parser library written in C.

dependencies.name: gdal
dependencies.description:
GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) is a translator library for
raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
X/MIT style Open Source license by the Open Source Geospatial
Foundation. As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data
model and vector abstract data model to the calling application for all
supported formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line
utilities for data translation and processing.

dependencies.name: geos
dependencies.description:
GEOS (Geometry Engine - Open Source) is a C++ port of the Java Topology
Suite (JTS). As such, it aims to contain the complete functionality of
JTS in C++. This includes all the OpenGIS Simple Features for SQL
spatial predicate functions and spatial operators, as well as specific
JTS enhanced topology functions.

dependencies.name: libspatialindex
dependencies.description: C++ implementation of R*-tree, an MVR-tree and a TPR-tree with C API.

dependencies.name: libspatialite
dependencies.description:
SpatiaLite is an open source library intended to extend the SQLite core
to support fully fledged Spatial SQL capabilities.

dependencies.name: libzip
dependencies.description: libzip is a C library for reading, creating, and modifying zip archives.

dependencies.name: libtasn1
dependencies.description: ASN.1 structure parser library.

dependencies.name: proj
dependencies.description:
PROJ is a generic coordinate transformation software, that transforms
geospatial coordinates from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to
another. This includes cartographic projections as well as geodetic
transformations.

dependencies.name: py-psycopg2
dependencies.description: Python interface to PostgreSQL databases

dependencies.name: py-pyqt4
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt4 supports Qt v4
and will build against Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt5
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt5 supports Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-requests
dependencies.description: Python HTTP for Humans.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: qca
dependencies.description:
Taking a hint from the similarly-named Java Cryptography Architecture,
QCA aims to provide a straightforward and cross-platform crypto API,
using Qt datatypes and conventions. QCA separates the API from the
implementation, using plugins known as Providers. The advantage of this
model is to allow applications to avoid linking to or explicitly
depending on any particular cryptographic library. This allows one to
easily change or upgrade crypto implementations without even needing to
recompile the application! QCA should work everywhere Qt does, including
Windows/Unix/MacOSX.

dependencies.name: qjson
dependencies.description:
QJson is a Qt-based library that maps JSON data to QVariant objects and
vice versa.

dependencies.name: qscintilla
dependencies.description:
QScintilla is a port to Qt of Neil Hodgson's Scintilla C++ editor
control.

dependencies.name: qt
dependencies.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependencies.name: qtkeychain
dependencies.description: Platform-independent Qt API for storing passwords securely.

dependencies.name: qwt
dependencies.description:
The Qwt library contains GUI Components and utility classes which are
primarily useful for programs with a technical background. Beside a
framework for 2D plots it provides scales, sliders, dials, compasses,
thermometers, wheels and knobs to control or display values, arrays, or
ranges of type double.

dependencies.name: qwtpolar
dependencies.description:
The QwtPolar library contains classes for displaying values on a polar
coordinate system.

dependencies.name: sqlite
dependencies.description:
SQLite3 is an SQL database engine in a C library. Programs that link the
SQLite3 library can have SQL database access without running a separate
RDBMS process.

dependencies.name: protobuf
dependencies.description: Google's data interchange format.

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-owslib
dependencies.description:
OWSLib is a Python package for client programming with Open Geospatial
Consortium (OGC) web service (hence OWS) interface standards, and their
related content models.

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-pygments
dependencies.description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.

dependencies.name: postgresql
dependencies.description:
PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system.
It has more than 15 years of active development and a proven
architecture that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability,
data integrity, and correctness.

dependencies.name: gsl
dependencies.description:
The GNU Scientific Library (GSL) is a numerical library for C and C++
programmers. It is free software under the GNU General Public License.
The library provides a wide range of mathematical routines such as
random number generators, special functions and least-squares fitting.
There are over 1000 functions in total with an extensive test suite.

dependencies.name: grass
dependencies.description:
GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System), is a free and
open source Geographic Information System (GIS) software suite used for
geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics and
maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization.

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries
